description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8vma0","text":"In a recent study we constructed a high-quality chromosome-level reference genome for the maize cultivar Dan340 by combining PacBio long HiFi sequencing reads, Illumina short reads and chromosomal conformational capture (Hi-C) sequencing reads. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"65qpc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4n8o0","text":"A Hi-C library was constructed using young leaves following previously published procedures with slight modifications. See the source paper and the following protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ddfl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a02ul","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1i0na","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Belton JM, McCord RP, Gibcus JH, Naumova N, Zhan Y, Dekker J","can_edit":1,"date":"1351728000","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ymeth.2012.05.001","guid":"77765F40D68A11ECB58B674884077531","id":1786,"journal":"Methods (San Diego, Calif.)","protocol_id":"0","title":"Hi-C: a comprehensive technique to capture the conformation of genomes."}}}}

references.title: Hi-C: a comprehensive technique to capture the conformation of genomes.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8s1g3","text":"Approximately leaf samples from seedling were cut into minute pieces and cross-linked by 4% formaldehyde solution at room temperature in a vacuum for .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":149,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"m6p8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"18FF8680D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"38979960D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cuumv","text":"Each sample was mixed with an excess of   glycine to quench the crosslinking reaction for   and then placed on ice for .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":40,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":90,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":118,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ad5uc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"2.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"410B99C0D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":21}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"4E159D00D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"52250AC0D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6e0dl","text":"The cross-linked DNA was extracted and then digested for   with 20 units of DpnII restriction enzyme (NEB) at  , and the resuspended mixture was incubated at  for  to inactivate the restriction enzyme.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":57,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":110,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":157,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":162,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2vomf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":43200,"guid":"605A6EA0D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"72CC91D0D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"69D70560D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"65","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"652BA5C0D68011EC844AE9D25587468E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94r1c","text":"The sticky ends of the digested fragments were biotinylated and proximity ligated to form enriched ligation junctions and then ultrasonically sheared to a size of 300 - 600 bp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ks5d","text":"The biotin-labelled DNA fragments were pulled down and ligated with Illumina paired-end adapters, and then amplified by PCR to produce the Hi-C sequencing library.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvlne","text":"The library was sequenced using an Illumina HiSeq X Ten platform with 2 Ã— 150 bp paired-end reads (Illumina, San Diego, CA, USA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2m576","text":"After removing low-quality sequences and trimming adapter sequences, we had 304.37 Gb (approximately 130Ã—) of clean data generated. This is then used for genome assembly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
